resources.string:
1. Reticulated Python
 Scientific name: Malayopython reticulatus 
 Length: > 1000 cm 
 Colour: Yellow, brown, black 
 Pattern: • Rhomboidal markings • Oblique Line from snout to nape and eye to cornered of mouth 
 Belly: Yellow with brown spot 
 Eyes: Small, Vertical pupil 
 Habitat: Forest (at edge of water), can also be found in cities, towns and plantations, live on land, in water, on trees 
 Active: Mostly during night but still active during day 
 Food Bird, Frog, Lizard, Rodent/Mammal

2. Malayan Pit Viper 
 Scientific name: Calloselasma rhodostoma 
 Length: 145 cm 
 Colour: Reddish brown or Purplish Brown 
 Pattern: • Dark brown sub-trianglular mark •Dark post-ocular stripe, scalloped ventrally until the angle of jaws 
 Belly: Pinkish cream, mottled with brown 
 Eyes: Vertical pupil 
 Habitat: Dry lowland forests and plantations 
 Active: During night or day 
 Food Bird, Frog, Lizard, Rodent/Mammal
